answers.answer: I had high blood pressure all through my first pregnancy. But luckily it didn't turn into preeclampsia. But it can be a struggle and headache to deal with just don't eat a lot of salt. Another piece of advice would be eat meats that are lean and lots of fruit and veggies. Good luck.

I had preclympsia in my last pregnancy was induced in labor for 17 hours then had an emergency c-section because I wasn't dialated my daughter was born at 37weeks 7 pounds 19inches ...my dr has me on baby aspirin to try to avoid it this pregnancy in current 21 weeks with my 2nd child the dr said it is too early to tell if i get it again I've been having headaches and he told me to drink a Tylenol and if it dosent go away let him know ...headaches and high blood pressure are symptoms of preclympsia

question: I am 13 wks and had an appointment yesterday n was diagnosed with chronic hp but can turn into preclasmpia
title: Anyone been diagnosed with preclasmpia(how ever u spell it) eary in ur pregnancy
